3 Power-over-CoaXPress

The microEnable 5 CoaXPress Series frame grabber support basically Power-over-CoaXPress cameras, since Power-Over-CoaXPress (PoCXP) is a mandatory feature of the CoaXPress standard.

The microEnable 5 CoaXPress Series frame grabber frame grabber has a special connector (4pin Molex) at the rear end that has necessarily to be connected to provide frame grabber power and PoCXP at the BNC connectors. This connector can be connected to a standard Molex 4pin power connector of a PC power supply.



4 CLHS Ports

4.1 BNC Ports 1 - 4




4.2 CoaXPress DIN 1.0/2.3 Ports 1 - 4



The fifth connector is preserved for an additional high speed upconnection.

7 Trigger Output 3 Port A GND 8

25 Trigger Input 4 Port B GND 26
27 Trigger Input 5 Port B GND 28
29 Trigger Input 6 Port B GND 30
31 Trigger Input 7 Port B VCCIO (+3.3V) 32
33 Presence Detect VCCIO (+3.3V) 34

 Plug assignment of the trigger plug (34 pin flat cable).

Default I/O configuration: 3.3V logic level signals (LVCMOS33). Signals are driven by open-collector drivers, pullups are on-board.


Please refer to the sections Opto Trigger for microEnable IV and TTL Trigger, respectively, to learn how trigger extension boards are connected and used. Please refer to the specific Applet documentation to learn how the trigger signals can be used.




6 Important note regarding PCIe bus data through-put

The data throughput is depending on the PC motherboard, chip-set and BIOS configuration and can be differ from slot to slot, or can even be dependent from the number of installed PCIe-boards. Furthermore for example a PCIe x8 slot maybe supports only x4 performance. Therefore carefully check the mainboard manual.
